thread.title: Bills' Ryan won't rule out QB Taylor despite sprained knee
thread.title_full: Bills' Ryan won't rule out QB Taylor despite sprained knee

author: JOHN WAWROW
title: Bills' Ryan won't rule out QB Taylor despite sprained knee
text:
Mark Zaleski Bills' Ryan won't rule out QB Taylor despite sprained knee 
Buffalo Bills quarterback Tyrod Taylor (5) is brought down in the first half of an NFL football game against the Tennessee Titans, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, in Nashville, Tenn. (AP Photo/Mark Zaleski) Mark Zaleski Bills' Ryan won't rule out QB Taylor despite sprained knee 
El quarterback de los Bills de Búfalo, Tyrod Taylor, lanza un pase en la primera mitad del encuentro del domingo 11 de octubre de 2015, frente a los Titans de Tennessee (AP Foto/Mark Zaleski) Gary Wiepert Bills' Ryan won't rule out QB Taylor despite sprained knee 
FILE - In this Sept. 13, 2015, file photo, Buffalo Bills head coach Rex Ryan stands on the sidelines during the first half of an NFL football game against the Indianapolis Colts in Orchard Park, N.Y. Marcus Mariota has put up some impressive numbers in his first three games with Tennessee. Bills coach Rex Ryan says the rookie quarterback's not going to have his way with Buffalo's defense. (AP Photo/Gary Wiepert, File) Posted: Wednesday, October 14, 2015 8:09 am | Updated: 11:00 am, Wed Oct 14, 2015. Bills' Ryan won't rule out QB Taylor despite sprained knee Associated Press | 
ORCHARD PARK, N.Y. (AP) — Though Buffalo Bills starting quarterback Tyrod Taylor has a sprained left knee, coach Rex Ryan won't entirely rule him out from playing against Cincinnati on Sunday. 
Ryan provided the update before the team's practice on Wednesday. Ryan said Taylor would practice on a limited basis, with backup EJ Manuel taking a majority of the snaps.
